content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here is an implementation of the function in Julia:

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Find all blocks of code using regex
    codes = collect(eachmatch(r"```julia\n([\s\S]*?)\n```", md))
    
    if isempty(codes) 
        return "" 
    end

    # Remove the code fences and join all blocks into a single string with newline
    joined_code = join([m.captures[1] for m in codes], "\n")

    return joined_code
end
```

This function uses a regular expression to match all blocks of Julia code in the markdown document `md`. It then removes the code fences and joins the code blocks into a single string with newline characters. If there are no matches, it returns an empty string. 

Please note that this implementation assumes that the code is well-formed. For example, it expects each code block to be terminated by a newline followed by three backticks (```).
